item.title: How to avoid putting your project in a straight-jacket with inappropriate constraints.
item.description: Inappropriate Constraints In many software practices, ‘business requirements’ end up not being actual business requirements. A requirement is something essential to the existence of the system.

item.title: How over-reliance on use case modeling can crash your project.
item.description: The Problem. In many software practices, there is an overemphasis on use case modeling. Often, use cases are presented as the only technique for identifying and analyzing business requirements.

item.title: Six things you can do to protect yourself from 18 common mistakes in Requirements and Specifications that will tank your project.
item.description: 18 Red Flags. Here are eighteen things you should be on the alert for to help you recognize poor quality business requirements and domain specifications in your software practice.
